title: 109_hr1614
content:
The "Estate Tax Reduction Act of 2005" is cited as the short title. It includes a 20 percent reduction in estate tax rates according to an amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The tentative tax rates are as follows:
- Not over $10,000: 14.4%
- Over $10,000 but not over $20,000: $1,440 plus 16% of the excess over $10,000
- Over $20,000 but not over $40,000: $3,040 plus 17.6% of the excess over $20,000
- Over $40,000 but not over $60,000: $6,560 plus 19.2% of the excess over $40,000 For incomes over $40,000 but not over $60,000, the tax rate is $10,400 plus 20.8%. For incomes over $60,000 but not over $80,000, the tax rate is $14,560 plus 22.4%. For incomes over $80,000 but not over $100,000, the tax rate is $19,040 plus 24%. For incomes over $100,000 but not over $150,000, the tax rate is $31,040 plus 25.6%. For incomes over $250,000 but not over $500,000, the tax rate is $56,640 plus 27.2%. For incomes over $500,000 but not over $750,000, the tax rate is $124,640 plus 29.6%. For incomes over $750,000 but not over $1,000,000, the tax rate is $198,640 plus 31.2%. For incomes over $1,000,000 but not over $1,250,000, the tax rate varies. For incomes over $1,000,000 but not over $1,250,000, the tax rate is $276,640 plus 32.8%. For incomes over $1,250,000 but not over $1,500,000, the tax rate is $358,640 plus 34.4%. For incomes over $1,500,000 but not over $2,000,000, the tax rate is $444,640 plus 36%. For incomes over $2,000,000, the tax rate is $624,640 plus 39.2%. The amendment applies to estates and gifts over $2,000,000 for decedents dying after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. Unified credit increased to $3,000,000 exclusion; inflation adjustment. The Unified Credit in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is increased to $3,000,000 with a cost-of-living adjustment for decedents and gifts made after 2005. The Unified Credit in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is increased to $3,000,000 with a cost-of-living adjustment for decedents and gifts made after 2005. Amendments made by this section apply to estates of decedents dying, and gifts made, after the date of the enactment of this Act.
